raw_response:
Thought: To determine if a number is prime, we can check if it's divisible by any integer from 2 up to the square root of the number. If no divisors are found, it's prime.
```ruby
def is_prime?(num)
  return false if num <= 1
  (2..Math.sqrt(num).to_i).none? { |i| num % i == 0 }
end
final_answer(answer: is_prime?(29))
```
